meanings.definition: In a way that indicates or marks the end of something.
meanings.sent1: The movie ended terminatively, leaving the audience satisfied.
meanings.sent2: She spoke terminatively, signaling the conclusion of the meeting.
meanings.sent3: The magician terminatively made the rabbit disappear at the end of the show.
meanings.sent4: The sun terminatively set, painting the sky in hues of orange and pink.
meanings.sent5: The detective terminatively solved the case, bringing closure to the mystery.

meanings.sent1: He terminatively closed the book after finishing the last page.
meanings.sent2: The chef terminatively garnished the dish with a sprinkle of parsley.
meanings.sent3: The teacher terminatively ended the lesson with a fun activity.
meanings.sent4: The conductor terminatively directed the orchestra to finish the symphony.
meanings.sent5: The janitor terminatively cleaned the hallway, making it spotless.
